author: Jen
title: Mosques urged to step up security amid fear of vigilante reprisal attacks
text:
Mohammed Shafiq (Picture: BBC) More than 1,500 mosques have been urged to step up security amid fears of revenge attacks. 
Four people died, including the attacker, during a terror attack in London yesterday when pedestrians were driven into on Westminster Bridge and a police officer was stabbed outside Parliament.
London Muslims raise thousands for victims of terror attack in Westminster Mohammed Shafiq, chief executive of the Ramadhan Foundation, said he had written to mosques urging them to work with local police to discuss security measures.
‘Sadly, after such terrorist atrocities innocent Muslims and our mosques are deliberately targeted as acts of Muslim hatred,’ he said.
‘We need to remain vigilant and resolute to not allow anyone to divide our communities.’
Paying tribute to PC Keith Palmer, Mr Shafiq said he was ‘killed in the line of service defending our democracy.
Mr Shafiq paid tribute to PC Palmer (Picture: PA) A policewoman patrols outside a North London mosque (Archive picture: Rex) ‘We pay tribute to him and offer our prayers, condolences and solidarity to his family and friends.’
He described the attack as ‘the worst of humanity’ and urged communities to remain united.
More than £30,000 raised for murdered PC Keith Palmer ‘The coming days will be difficult for British Muslims,’ he said. ‘We are dealing with the immediate response to the terrorist attack and then have to put up with hatred and violence directed towards members of our community.
‘The terrorists aim to divide communities, the far right are doing the work of these terrorist groups by perpetuating the division and hatred.
‘But as British citizens, we will continue to work to bring people together and defeat the ideology of violence.
 
‘We saw the worse of humanity in the terrorist attack on Parliament but we also saw the best of humanity.
‘The emergency services, police and members of the public rushing to help victims despite the personal risk – that is the best of humanity and what London and the United Kingdom is all about.’
